segment.source: Operations Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0
segment.target: Operations Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0

segment.source: Operations Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0
segment.target: Operations Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0

segment.source: Operations Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0
segment.target: Operations Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0

segment.source: You can use Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) to extend the capabilities of the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: You can use Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) to extend the capabilities of the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: AGPM provides comprehensive change control and improved management of Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
segment.target: AGPM provides comprehensive change control and improved management of Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

segment.source: Using AGPM, you can do these tasks:
segment.target: Using AGPM, you can do these tasks:

segment.source: Perform offline editing of GPOs so that you can create and test them before you deploy them to a production environment.
segment.target: Perform offline editing of GPOs so that you can create and test them before you deploy them to a production environment.

segment.source: Maintain multiple versions of a GPO in a central archive so that you can roll back if a problem occurs.
segment.target: Maintain multiple versions of a GPO in a central archive so that you can roll back if a problem occurs.

segment.source: Share the responsibility for editing, approving, and reviewing GPOs among multiple people by using role-based delegation.
segment.target: Share the responsibility for editing, approving, and reviewing GPOs among multiple people by using role-based delegation.

segment.source: Eliminate the danger of multiple Group Policy administrators overwriting one another's work by using the check-in and check-out capability for GPOs.
segment.target: Eliminate the danger of multiple Group Policy administrators overwriting one another's work by using the check-in and check-out capability for GPOs.

segment.source: Analyze changes to a GPO, comparing it to another GPO or another version of the same GPO by using difference reporting.
segment.target: Analyze changes to a GPO, comparing it to another GPO or another version of the same GPO by using difference reporting.

segment.source: Simplify creating new GPOs by using GPO templates, storing common policy settings and preference settings to use as starting points for new GPOs.
segment.target: Simplify creating new GPOs by using GPO templates, storing common policy settings and preference settings to use as starting points for new GPOs.

segment.source: Delegate access to the production environment.
segment.target: Delegate access to the production environment.

segment.source: Search for GPOs with specific attributes and filter the list of GPOs displayed.
segment.target: Search for GPOs with specific attributes and filter the list of GPOs displayed.

segment.source: Export a GPO to a file so that you can copy it from a domain in a test forest to a domain in a production forest.
segment.target: Export a GPO to a file so that you can copy it from a domain in a test forest to a domain in a production forest.

segment.source: AGPM adds a Change Control folder under each domain displayed in the GPMC, in addition to a History tab for each GPO and Group Policy link displayed in the GPMC.
segment.target: AGPM adds a Change Control folder under each domain displayed in the GPMC, in addition to a History tab for each GPO and Group Policy link displayed in the GPMC.
